title: 145 Followers
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Find the minimum value of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1+{ a }^{ 4 }+{ b }^{ 8 }"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" if a and b are positive real numbers with "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a{ b }^{ 2 }=5"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"horizontalRule"},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"heading","attrs":[{"level":6}],"content":[{"type":"text","text":"You may even like a tougher and a bit more challenging question by me which is in sequel to this."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"heading","attrs":[{"level":6}],"content":[{"type":"text","text":"If you want to help me and others in NMTC final level problems then you may even like this."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"I wanted to put emphasis on a common misuse of the AM-GM inequality on "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1 + a^4 + b^8"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":": "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Since a, b are positive, 
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1 + a^4 + b^8 \geq 3 \times \sqrt[3]{a^4 b^8} = 3(a b^2)^{\frac{4}{3}} = 3 \times 5^{\frac{4}{3}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Equality occurs when "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1 = a^4 = b^8 = 5^{\frac{4}{3}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":".  But "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1 = 5^{\frac{4}{3}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is a contradiction.  So while "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3 \times 5^{\frac{4}{3}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" represents a lower bound on the expression, it does "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\underline{not}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" a minimum."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Instead, apply the AM-GM Inequality on "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a^4 + b^8"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a^4 + b^8 \geq 2 \times \sqrt[2]{a^4 b^8}= (a b^2)^{2} = 2 \times 5^2"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Equality occurs when "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a^4 = b^8 = 25 \Rightarrow a = \sqrt[2]{5}, b = \sqrt[4]{5} "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Therefore, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"min(a^4 + b^8) = 50 \Rightarrow min(1 + a^4 + b^8) = 1+ 50 = \boxed{51}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" (which I should note is greater than "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"3 \times 5^{\frac{4}{3}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":") :)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b^2=\dfrac 5 a. ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ b^8=\left(\dfrac 5 a \right)^4.\\
f(a)=1+a^4+\left(\dfrac 5 a \right)^4, ~~ f '(a)=0 \implies ~~ a=\sqrt 5.\\
f "(a)>0, ~~ so ~ ~~~ a=\sqrt 5. ~ is ~ min.\\
f(a)_{min}=1+(\sqrt 5)^4+\left(\dfrac 5 {\sqrt 5} \right)^4=\Large \color{#D61F06}{51}  "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

comments.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Sir can't we apply AM-GM on a^4 and b^8 ?? by applying we get that a^4+b^4=50 . so minimum value = 50+1=51

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

The answer is 51 only (what it shows in my pc) btw "},{"type":"mention","content":[{"type":"text","text":"@Andrew Ellinor"}],"attrs":[{"profile":"https://brilliant.org/profile/andrew-ujvet5/"}]},{"type":"text","text":" sir has already changed my question to integer earlier and it might even happen he changed the answer to something different. Btw what is the new answer? Also the name of my problem has been changed. This is probably a work of a moderator. "}]},{"type":"text","text":" "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"mention","content":[{"type":"text","text":" @Satyajit Ghosh – "}],"attrs":[{"profile":""}]},{"type":"text","text":" why isnt the ans 51 at "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":" \begin{cases} a=\sqrt{5}\\b=\sqrt[4]{5}\end{cases}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}},{"type":"text","text":". by simple am-gm? "}]},{"type":"text","text":" "}]}

"}]},{"type":"text","text":" "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"mention","content":[{"type":"text","text":" @Satyajit Ghosh – "}],"attrs":[{"profile":""}]},{"type":"text","text":" I see. Thank you. I am new here and do not know the rules. I just wanted to brush up on my math skills that I have not used in 15 years. "}]},{"type":"text","text":" "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            That's what I had changed in the question that they are real numbers not integers but a moderator had again changed it to integers. Taking them as real numbers you will have the answer as 51 only, just apply AM-GM or Cauchy

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Why can a not be 5 and b be 1?  Aren't these both integers that make the equation true? Then the answer would be 502

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Please change the line of question to "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"b"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are positive reals

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            They are not positive integers they are positive reals bangali

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

title: 144 is an awesome number!
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Since today is "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"14^{th}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" April (14/4), I have created an expression involving 144 of the number 144:"}]},{"type":"text","text":"\n\n"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"(144 - 0^2)(144 - 1^2)(144 - 2^2).....(144-142^2)(144-143^2)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]}]}
